001package com.telos.loops.lists;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference;
004import com.telos.loops.internal.CoreSender;
005import com.telos.loops.internal.mappers.MailingListsMapper;
006import com.telos.loops.model.RequestOptions;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.List;
009import java.util.Objects;
010import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
011import java.util.stream.Collectors;
012
013/**
014 * Client for managing mailing lists in Loops.
015 *
016 * <p>This client provides read-only access to view all mailing lists configured in your Loops
017 * account. Mailing lists can be used to organize and segment your contacts.
018 *
019 * <h2>Example Usage</h2>
020 *
021 * <pre>{@code
022 * LoopsClient client = LoopsClient.builder()
023 *         .apiKey("your-api-key")
024 *         .build();
025 *
026 * // List all mailing lists
027 * List<MailingList> lists = client.mailingLists().list();
028 *
029 * // Display list information
030 * for (MailingList list : lists) {
031 *     System.out.println("List ID: " + list.id());
032 *     System.out.println("List Name: " + list.name());
033 *     System.out.println("Is Default: " + list.isDefault());
034 * }
035 *
036 * // Async example
037 * CompletableFuture<List<MailingList>> future =
038 *     client.mailingLists().listAsync();
039 * }</pre>
040 *
041 * <p>All methods are available in both synchronous and asynchronous (CompletableFuture) variants.
042 *
043 * @see com.telos.loops.LoopsClient
044 */
045public class MailingListsClient {
046  private static final String LIST_PATH = "/lists";
047
048  private final CoreSender sender;
049
050  public MailingListsClient(CoreSender sender) {
051    this.sender = Objects.requireNonNull(sender);
052  }
053
054  // ============================================================
055  // List Operations
056  // ============================================================
057
058  /**
059   * Lists all mailing lists in your Loops account.
060   *
061   * <p>This method uses default request options.
062   *
063   * @return a list of all mailing lists
064   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
065   * @see #listAsync() for the asynchronous variant
066   */
067  public List<MailingList> list() {
068    return list(RequestOptions.none());
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Lists all mailing lists in your Loops account with custom request options.
073   *
074   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
075   * @return a list of all mailing lists
076   * @throws com.telos.loops.error.LoopsApiException if the API returns an error
077   * @see #listAsync(RequestOptions) for the asynchronous variant
078   */
079  public List<MailingList> list(RequestOptions options) {
080    var generatedLists =
081        sender.getList(
082            LIST_PATH,
083            new HashMap<>(),
084            new TypeReference<List<com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.MailingList>>() {},
085            options);
086    return generatedLists.stream()
087        .map(MailingListsMapper::fromGenerated)
088        .collect(Collectors.toList());
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Asynchronously lists all mailing lists in your Loops account.
093   *
094   * <p>This method uses default request options.
095   *
096   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of all mailing lists
097   * @see #list() for the synchronous variant
098   */
099  public CompletableFuture<List<MailingList>> listAsync() {
100    return listAsync(RequestOptions.none());
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Asynchronously lists all mailing lists in your Loops account with custom request options.
105   *
106   * @param options additional request options such as custom headers
107   * @return a CompletableFuture containing a list of all mailing lists
108   * @see #list(RequestOptions) for the synchronous variant
109   */
110  public CompletableFuture<List<MailingList>> listAsync(RequestOptions options) {
111    return sender
112        .getListAsync(
113            LIST_PATH,
114            new HashMap<>(),
115            new TypeReference<List<com.telos.loops.internal.openapi.model.MailingList>>() {},
116            options)
117        .thenApply(
118            generatedLists ->
119                generatedLists.stream()
120                    .map(MailingListsMapper::fromGenerated)
121                    .collect(Collectors.toList()));
122  }
123}
